JobFullDesc:
Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.

Elastic is a free and open search company that powers enterprise search, observability, and security solutions built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real-time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Barclays, Cisco, eBay, Fairfax, ING, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe. Learn more at elastic.co.

Elastic is growing our Services Team to support the US Federal customers in the DC Metro area as well as various other locations. 

If you are an experienced Program or Project Manager that is looking for a role in support of the United States Department of Defense, we want to meet you! 

The successful candidate will be happy working on their own initiative and will not require micro-management. Most of the team works remotely, and we are happy to consider you wherever you live, East Coast  preferred. 

 

What You Will Be Doing:

Create and maintain comprehensive project documentationEstablish and maintain relationships with internal teams, Stakeholders and third parties/vendorsDevelop comprehensive project plans to monitor and track progressMeasure project performance using appropriate tools and techniquesAssist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility

What You Bring Along:

5+ Years Working in the U.S. Federal/SLED environment as an Program Manager or Project ManagerPMP Certification Clear, concise, timely, and accurate communications (both written and verbal) with the right audience. Drives business and technical discussions.Project Management Information System experience: Monday.com, MS Project to name a fewCreates Project Management Plan, including project milestones/timelines, manages project hoursRuns all project-related meetingsEnsures team is committing appropriately and delivering according to commitments
Bonus Points:
Active U.S. Federal security clearance - Secret or higherBachelor’s degree or equivalent work experienceUnderstanding of Elasticsearch and/or Lucene a plusExcellent interpersonal, leadership, presentation, and collaborative skills to work effectively with teams throughout the organization.Strong communication, relationship building, and organization skills
